Class Alarm

  • java.lang.Object
    • Alarm

  • public class Alarm
extends java.lang.Object
    The Alarm class creates an alarm object that functions as a real world alarm that set the time,turns the alarm off and on and checks if the alarm was set
    Version:
    2019.01.12
    Author:
    Micheal Kolling and David J. Barnes and Agina Oghenemena Benaiah

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Alarm()
      A default constructor setting the alarm time to midnight and alarm off
      Alarm(int hours, int minutes, java.lang.String time, boolean alarmCondition)
      A constructor that take the number of hours,minutes and specifies a.m or p.m and indicating if the alarm is set or not

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      gets the current alarm time

      checks if the alarm time is set or not

      Set the alarm time with the number of hours, minutes specify a.m.

      Turns off the alarm
      void turnOn()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Alarm

        public Alarm()
        A default constructor setting the alarm time to midnight and alarm off

      • Alarm

        public Alarm(int hours,
             int minutes,
             java.lang.String time,
             boolean alarmCondition)
        A constructor that take the number of hours,minutes and specifies a.m or p.m and indicating if the alarm is set or not
        Parameters:
        hours - stores the number of hours in the alarm clock
        minutes - stores the number of minutes in the alarm clock
        time - stores a.m. or p.m entered to set the alarm time
        alarmCondition - sets the alarm to true(alarm is turned on) or false(alarm is turned off)

    • Method Detail

      • getTime

        public java.lang.String getTime()
        gets the current alarm time
        Returns:
        returns the current alarm time

      • isSet

        public boolean isSet()
        checks if the alarm time is set or not
        Returns:
        returns true if the alarm is set

      • setTime

        public void setTime(int hours,
                    int minutes,
                    java.lang.String time)
        Set the alarm time with the number of hours, minutes specify a.m. or p.m.
        Parameters:
        hours - stores the number of hours in the alarm clock
        minutes - stores the number of minutes in the alarm clock
        time - stores a.m. or p.m entered to set the alarm time

      • turnOff

        public void turnOff()
        Turns off the alarm

      • turnOn
